dialog.select: Select a page from the dropdown and drag it into your booklet. You can rearrange and delete pages of the booklet.

layers.same-layer: In the same layer: Dependency then timestamp order
layers.replacements1: Keywords: instead, skip, [this] enters the battlefield (with), as [this] enters the battlefield, as [this] is turned face up.
layers.replacements3: Choices made before the replaced event occurs.
layers.replacements4: If several replacement effects apply, affected player choose the order they apply.
layers.priority1: At the beginning of steps, after turn based actions and/or triggered abilities went to the stack, when a spell or ability resolves: AP.
layers.priority2: AP/NAP played a special cast a spell or activate an ability.: AP/NAP
layers.priority3: Priority: cast a spell, activate an ability; or perform a special action;
layers.priority4: If both players pass priority once, resolve the first object on the stack or pass to the next step.

abilities.cast2: Choose mode(s), announce value of variable costs, intent to play alternate costs, additional and special costs, and how hybrid & Phyrexian mana will be paid.
abilities.cast3: Choose targets and effect per target.
abilities.cast4: Determine costs. (taxes, then reductions, then Trinisphere)
abilities.resolve1: Determine targets legality. (countered if no legal target left)
abilities.resolve3: Determine choices not made on announcement.
abilities.resolve4: If actions require choices from multiple players, make them in APNAP order, then resolve those actions simultaneously.
abilities.resolve5: Use Last Known Info as necessary.
abilities.resolve6: Do as much as you can.
abilities.trigger1: Active player puts their triggered abilities on the stack in any order.
abilities.trigger2: Then in turn order, Non-Active Players do the same.
abilities.trigger3: Resolution in order 'last in, first out'.
abilities.mana1: Activated / Triggered ability that adds mana and does not target.
abilities.mana2: Does not use the stack (we canâ€™t respond to them.)
abilities.mana3: To activate: have priority, when a spell is cast or an ability is activated, or when an effect asks to pay a mana cost.

shortcuts.title: Tournament Shortcuts (MTR 4.2)
shortcuts.note: All these shortcuts are considered as a player statement unless they say otherwise.
shortcuts.shortcut1: Go: opponent has priority until the end step.
shortcuts.shortcut2: Declare attackers: opponent has priority until the beginning of combat step.
shortcuts.shortcut3: Priority: Whenever a player adds an object to the stack, they are assumed to be passing priority unless they explicitly announce that they intend to retain it.
shortcuts.shortcut4: If they add a group of objects to the stack without explicitly retaining priority and a player wishes to take an action at a point in the middle, the actions should be reversed up to that point.
shortcuts.shortcut5: X: all mana currently available in the pool.
shortcuts.shortcut7: Choice made during casting instead of resolution: must adhere to those choices unless an opponent responds.
shortcuts.shortcut8: If an opponent inquiries about choices made during resolution, that player is assumed to be passing priority and allowing that spell or ability to resolve.
shortcuts.shortcut9: Target of an object on the stack: legal target closest to the top of the stack unless otherwise stated.
shortcuts.shortcut10: Default attack: the opponent (and not their Planeswalkers)
shortcuts.shortcut11: Planeswalker targeted instead of their controller: target the controller and redirect damages at the resolution of the spell or
shortcuts.shortcut12: Forgot to scry: they chose to leave cards in the same order.

penalties.upgrades: Contains penalty upgrades (+) or downgrades (-) for specific cases.
